title: In how many states will Kanye West appear on the ballot for the 2020 presidential election?
preds:
According to Ballotpedia 12 + 2 Write In
https://ballotpedia.org/Kanye_West
Unlikely he will be on more than sixteen ballots.
his late start and the confusion caused by the Republican support to get him on the ballot to "weaken" the democratic candidate will cause a backlash, limiting his listing on ballots.
It is not easy to get on state ballots.
Updating based on recent news, still a possibility some of the ones he has get challenged I think but small enough to be negligible.
I think the most states he could get on is 17 which is unlikely. He will be on between nine and 16 states it looks like.

It seemed like this was pretty much done bar the shouting. Kanye seems to be starting to sue in states he didn’t get verified [1] [2] Not enough to change my opinion but any successes here would put the 17 to 24 bracket in contention (although not at all likely)  Holding firm for now but keeping an eye on things [1] https://uk.news.yahoo.com/kanye-west-sues-ohio-election-090000905.html [2] https://www.theglobeandmail.com/world/us-politics/article-kanye-west-sues-to-get-on-wisconsin-presidential-ballot/

Changing my second forecast to reflect that Kanye will definitely appear on at least nine state ballots and no more than 16 given new information. I left a 1% chance that something goes wrong and maybe he gets dropped from one state (he hasn't been the most punctual or thorough candidate thus far...)
He's on 9 now, barring some kind of late appeal he has to clear the first bucket. 2 pending and 5 states left means 16 would appear to be his absolute limit. So 9 to 16 it is.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanye_West_2020_presidential_campaign#Ballot_access "Qualified for presidential ballot access (nine states): 64 electoral votes – Arkansas, Colorado, Idaho, Louisiana, Minnesota, Oklahoma, Tennessee, Utah, Vermont Presidential ballot access pending verification (two states): 19 electoral votes – Iowa, Virginia Presidential ballot access deadline not yet passed (five states): 32 electoral votes – North Dakota (Aug. 31), Arizona (Sept. 4), Kentucky (Sept. 4), Mississippi (Sept. 4), Rhode Island (Sept. 4)"

He recently qualified for his 9th state, pending verification in two, and the deadline has not passed in five: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanye_West_2020_presidential_campaign#Ballot_access. Adding a small probability that his name doesn't show up on some states despite him qualifying.
He's on nine with 2 pending and 5 with deadlines ahead, meaning his max is 16. 100% 9-16.
Updating since I had originally incorrectly believed the campaign had given up on getting onto more state ballots

Well, when you're wrong you're wrong, and when you are fascinated by the inherent flaws associated with the inner workings of the American electoral system, it must be 2020. He's on 8 ballots right now with three pending approval and six whose deadline hasn't passed yet. Given his previous performance, he will likely make it onto at least 1 of the 3 pending ballots, and his campaign is almost guaranteed to make the deadline for at least a few of the remaining states given their August performance so far. He can't win, he may face fraud charges, but unless they redo the rulings he will be on 8 or more ballots.

Today Kanye failed to make Missouri and Wyoming [1] Current status 
On ballot 6
Awaiting verification 5
Deadline still in future 6 Prediction reflects this change in circumstances as well as an adjustment towards the consensus  1. https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/thehill.com/homenews/campaign/513559-kanye-west-fails-to-make-ballot-in-missouri-wyoming%3famp

Current state of play:
6 states on ballot
6 states awaiting verification
7 states deadline not passed (oregon and Wyoming is today) Outside view: 50% success on appearing on ballot in states he attempted, so assume 3 more of the 6 awaiting verification Inside view: you would expect he picks up some but all of the remaining 7. Although he could quit trying Max: 19 Min: 6

West has now successfully petitioned for as many states (6) as he has been rejected by. That sets his base rate at a 50% chance to qualify in a given state he submits paperwork for. He has 5 pending at the moment, putting his expected value at 7.5 states. There are also still 8 states without the deadline passed. He has applied to 17 states and missed 26 deadlines so far, putting his rate at around 40% chance he qualifies to be considered on a given ballot. So we can expect he will make around 3 of the 8 remaining deadlines, putting his expected total ballots at 9. However, there are some caveats.
On August 19th, Kanye had made it onto 5 ballots and withdrawn from 3, so in just three days he has been rejected on 75% of his pending petitions, a significant uptick from his 50% rate earlier. At this rate, his expected value is closer to 7 states (below 8). Moreover, it is possible his campaign could face election fraud charges given current allegations regarding their techniques, which will make future ballots harder to qualify for and will potentially make voters more wary of errant signatures.

West says God has granted him ballot space in ten states.  Secular sources peg it a lot lower, since his list includes all the states where he's applied and all the ones that haven't decided yet.  Stay tuned.

Apparently he's on in IA, which means he's on in 6 states w/ 4 more pending verification. There are also 9 states where the deadline hasn't passed yet. Going with my gut for now until we get more clarification.

@Jeffrey2020 gives a good overview of the current state of play regarding states still in play. 7 awaiting verification, 11 without deadline passed I’m a bit less confident in his ability to convert the remaining states. He is currentLy 45% in getting successfully verified in states he has filled. Of the 18 states still in play that would be an additional 8. So 13 in total. There is a chance he won’t get submissions in for the 11 states with deadline still open hence the increase in the 8 or fewer range.

Kanye has already qualified for ballot access in five states and is pending verification from seven. There are 11 more states where the ballot access deadline has not passed, so given he applies to all of these, that would put him at 5 + 7 + 11 = 23 MAX. However, there is no guarantee that the seven pending or 11 open applications will be approved, so between 9 and 16 Kanye ballot appearances seems like a safe bet (Although, between 17 and 24 appearances could be likely if he gets his act together to actually submit his applications for ballot access on time). https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanye_West_2020_presidential_campaign#:~:text=West%20has%20qualified%20for%20ballot,signatures%20on%20the%20submitted%20petition.

Of the state's Kanye has currently petitioned for, he has made it onto the ballot on 5 and had to withdraw from 3, meaning he has a baseline 37.5% chance of withdrawing or being dismissed on pending ballots. With 5 currently pending, that means he should make it onto around 3 of them, which would put him at the 8 state mark. However, issues have been raised regarding the legitimacy of his campaigns' signature collection methods. Specifically, some have suggested his petitioners are tricking voters into signing and that some of the signatures are fake. This means that, not only could his pending requests be thrown out more frequently than previously, but West himself could face fraud charges for his campaigns controversial strategies. That being said, he still has time to make it onto the last four he needs to escape the bottom rung of the question.

According to Wikipedia he's on the ballot in 6 states, pending in 5, and the deadline hasn't passed for 13 states (see second link with deadlines). That leaves a max of 24 states. Of the pending 5 and the remaining 13 my wild guess for a total based on how many he actually tries for and how many he tries for but succeeds at meeting the requirements is half. Which would put him at 15 states. That seems most likely, followed by 17 to 24 as second most likely. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanye_West_2020_presidential_campaign#Ballot_access
https://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/articles/the-clocks-ticking-for-kanye/

He's on the ballot in Iowa, Arkansas, Colorado, Oklahoma, Utah and Vermont, and has sought to be a contender in important battlegrounds such as Wisconsin. But West has missed the deadline in significant states such as his home state of Illinois, Florida, Nevada, New Mexico, North Carolina and Texas.
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2020/08/18/could-kanye-wests-2020-bid-hurt-biden-and-give-trump-hail-mary/3359303001/

Reading this:
https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2020/08/kanye-west-trying-to-get-on-ballot-in-two-more-purple-states.html It says he has already filed for registration in 3 states (Colorado, Wisconsion and Ohio). He is certified in Colorado but he is receiving challenges in Wisconsion, so as far as I'm concerned, he's only got one state so far. MAYBE he gets to 3 states, but that's a big MAYBE. He just filed for two more, Minnesota and Virginia. No guarantee he gets the clearance for those. Now let's assume he clears every state mentioned above, that is five states total. Elections are in two months and a half. I don't see how he gets to 8 states. Or why, for that matter, but that's a different discussion :P

4 with 6 pending, looking very likely he clears 8 but extremely unlikely he clears 16. 14 states left, so he could get to 24 but literally impossible for him to get more. He doesn't seem to be applying everywhere and he has verification problems in a couple of states. The crowd consensus on under 8 is completely wrong, and can only come from a lack of knowledge of his 6 pending states. Or I'm completely missing something.
Its should land between 7-9, depending on court cases. Lots of them have false signatures.

He's on 4 with 4 pending. It's not clear how many of the final 16 he's actually going to apply for, nor that his pending states are valid (he was a few seconds late in Wisconsin for example), but I do feel him clearing 8 is more likely than not.
He made it on the ballot in Arkansas. Not as hard to do as I though.
It's not a serious attempt and it's being bankrolled by Trump.  It's a desperate attempt to take votes from Biden.  So I just don't see it happening beyond  a few key swing states.

It seems like it's not going to happen at all per this Virginian Pilot article. https://www.pilotonline.com/government/elections/vp-nw-kanye-west-ballot-presidential-election-20200811-pgzco7suknhdxc2pb74q3op7ce-story.html West has submitted paperwork to get on the ballot in at least five states — Oklahoma, Ohio, Missouri, West Virginia and Colorado — according to newspapers from those states. In Wisconsin, the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel reports West submitted his nomination signatures 14 seconds after the 5 p.m. deadline Aug. 4. In Illinois, the Chicago Tribune reports 60% of West’s petition signatures were invalid. In Virginia, he’ll need to get the following to the Department of Elections by noon on Aug. 21 to get his name on the ballot:
Get 5,000 qualified voters to sign a petition, with at least 200 signatures coming from each of Virginia’s 11 congressional districts.
Get a pledge and notarized oath from 13 electors, one from each congressional district and two at-large electors. Electors can be anyone who isn’t a U.S. Senator or Representative or federal official
File a declaration of candidacy.
The elections department would then have to verify the signatures. If West files and the department determines he doesn’t qualify, he can appeal within seven days of the department’s denial. The board recently granted permission for several congressional candidates to appear on the ballot despite the candidates filing their paperwork late.

From Wikipedia: Qualified for ballot access (4 states): – Arkansas, Colorado, Oklahoma, Vermont
Ballot access pending verification (4 states): Missouri, Ohio, West Virginia, Wisconsin
Ballot access requirements submitted but withdrawn/dismissed (2 states): Illinois, New Jersey
Ballot access deadline missed (23 states + the District of Columbia): Alaska, California, Connecticut, Delaware, the District of Columbia, Florida, Hawaii, Indiana, Kansas, Massachusetts, Maryland, Michigan, Maine, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Nebraska, New Mexico, Nevada, New York, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, Washington
Ballot access deadline not yet passed (17 states) So it's 4 confirmed, 4 pending and 17's deadline has not passed yet but it seems his campaign is over.
This looks like a stunt, aimed at promoting music rather than a real effort to become president.
I don't have a lot of data here or research, but from everything I know getting on states isn't a trivial thing and a lot of deadlines are coming up quickly. Will look into more data tomorrow.

He has missed too many deadlines already to have >24. His joke of a "campaign" is too disorganized to get him on the ballet in most of the states where the deadline has not yet passed. He will fail to qualify in at least a couple of states where he has submitted names. I think it will be 8 or less in the end...and if it is more it will be 10 or less.
This would have been less tricky had Biden selected Kim as his running mate.

West is struggling to make the deadlines in many states, is mathematically out, and now may be facing electoral fraud charges. He is only officially on the ballot in Oklahoma, though his candidacy is pending among other states. However, it appears that many of his petitions are being challenged and are under review since accusations have surfaced that many of the signatures are fraudulent (one source citing 'Mickey Mouse' and 'Bernie Sanders' as two supporters) and multiple affidavits have been filed saying voters were tricked into putting their names down. Even if he was balloted on every state he has submitted a petition to so far, he still would not be on the ballot in more than 8 states and time running out for future petitions. Basically, it would be an incredibly unlikely, hard, and risky uphill climb for Kanye and his campaign staff that could land them in jail, mathematically can't win him the presidency, and would almost undoubtedly end with damage to the Kanye brand, his mental health, and his bottom line.
Most deadlines have already passed. He'll make an impact in a few swing states.

As of 8/9 West has ballot petitions in 10 states (https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/kanye-west-ballot-campaign-gop/2020/08/09/bfc8e58a-d8ce-11ea-9c3b-dfc394c03988_story.html), two of which rejected his petition. Reports of invalid signatures in Illinois and New Jersey decrease the probability these petitions will be accepted.

A publicly known mental health condition is not a good prerequisite for becoming the most powerful man on Earth.
Furter states may deny his name on their ballots on that reasoning. Although...

This is the nuttiest article I've read in a while: https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackbrewster/2020/08/04/heres-why-this-week-is-make-or-break-for-kanye-wests-presidential-campaign/#7f9ee26e7fc5 Thank you, I'd like to get off this merry-go-round now, please.
Adjusting down as this continues to play out more as dark comedy than gripping drama or political thriller.

Already being denied in one state does not bode well for his general due diligence. Assuming he is run as a splitter to the Biden support, then it's most likely not even necessary to have him run in many states. Will revisit (if I remember, no promises) next weekend. Then another 3 deadlines and hopefully another couple of states will have decided. In theory 25 are still possible, but I would be surprised if he tries to get on every ballot and even more surprised if he would be able to fulfil all requirements. Even 17 is a stretch.

What a time to be alive... https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackbrewster/2020/08/06/heres-where-a-kanye-west-presidential-run-could-play-spoiler/#cc640bf4e6df (The tide will turn on this one in the next few days.)
There just are not a lot of states left he can get on he ballot.

If the R’s are truly just using him as a spoiler candidate, they’ll push to get him on as many swing state ballots as they can. Maybe 11-14? At this point, the political operatives are calling the shots, and poor Mr. West is just along for the ride.
https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/at-least-6-gop-operatives-working-to-get-kanye-west-on-the-2020-ballot/ar-BB17F4u6
Current RNC operatives are attempting to get him on the ballot in as many states as possible!
I now see he may have been late in Wisconsin. The chances of him ending up on almost no ballots shouldn't be discounted.

More than half of his signatures in Illinois were thrown out, so I'm sharply revising down his states. He also had problems in NJ, it's looking like there are problems across his effort. Clearing 9 is still very likely, but clearing 16 is looking pretty tough.
I bet he will accomplish several filings, but I only lean slightly towards higher quantities

He's on the ballot on 3.
He's submitted papers for 6.
He's missed the deadline for 23 (inc. DC and NJ).
That leaves him 19 to apply for. His starting point therefore is 9. Maybe he'll lose legal challenges in one or two, but 8 or fewer appears almost impossible given he'd need to lose more legal challenges than new states he submit for. His maximum is therefore 28, but some of those are extremely hard (such as California, which needed 200k signatures by today). It appears he isn't really trying to get on everywhere, so he probably won't even try all 19 remaining states. If he gets on at more than 7 additional states then he clears the second option. Given he's done 9 in about a month, that seems likely but far from certain. http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/articles/the-clocks-ticking-for-kanye/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanye_West_2020_presidential_campaign#Ballot_access
With support from the Trump campaign, Kanye will try maximize the splitting of votes. He has missed ~10 states and is running against time on many others.

As of today, 26 states filing deadlines have already passed, with another dozen due within 2 weeks. Of those that have already passed, he has only made it onto the ballot for four (Arkansas, Oklahoma, Illinois, and Missouri), so he would have to bat nearly 100% for the remaining states to get over 24. California's deadline ends today, and if he fails to make it then it would be mathematically impossible for him to win the White House, meaning his run may end today depending on it's purpose (substance vs. statement). 
West also, per reports, has support from the president and various GOP operatives, who are assisting him in collecting signatures in several purple states that could play an important role in the upcoming election. They, however, care little about deep red or blue states, as those will likely not swing no matter who he pulls votes from. However, with this backing, it is entirely possible that he will meet thresholds in more than 8 states, though it remains unlikely he will get above 17 since he would need his name on over half of the remaining ballots to hit this lower limit.
